headline: Were the eldan proginated or proginators?
content: Like many questions pertaining to the Eldan, I have to remain silent.

headline: So, the Eldan weren't meat-and-bone kind of creatures? (only thing I know of them is that they're a mystery :))
content: Yeah, it's a big mystery. I can neither confirm nor deny their structural composition.

headline: Is Nazrek the Eldan that screwed with the matrix and, thus, created the Entity?  After all, he messed with Ohma's skeech.
content: I'm unable to reveal if your theory has merit or not. I'm sure things will be made clear in time.

headline: Theres an eldan orders. Theres order of Shapers. Is there anyone who are important Shaper excepr Koral?
content: Though there were other Shapers on Nexus, Koral is the only one players become familiar with (through his Datacube entries)..

headline: In terms of the eldan, how many were working on nexus? was it just the named ones we've seen/heard in the cubes or were there others?
content: There were definitely more Eldan than those heard in the various Datacubes, but the total number is undisclosed. There were more than ten.

headline: What Eldan machines so far deal with the main plot of the Genesis Prime?
content: Glimpses of those machines have been seen in the Drusera instances.

headline: Aviel/Order of Weavers and Aurin Matriarchs/the Weave... is there a connection here?
content:
Nope. The Aurin concept of the Weave isn't related to the Eldan Order of the Weavers.

The Eldan Weavers specialized in the dynamics associated with combining and infusing primal energies.

The Aurin Weave is more of a philosophical belief system, wherein nature is a supernatural tapestry of sorts.
